  • City: CONCORD

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A manager in the bulk area brought us this bucket/pail because it looked like there was a little leak on top of the pail at the cap. We inspected and it did have a loose cap and a small leak on top and down the side of the pail. We made sure to get this isolated in the hazmat cage in a lined hazmat tote. DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We made sure that this pail didn't leak on any other packages and then we moved it to the hazmat cage immediately.

item.title: Report E-2023060137
item.description:
Report E-2023060137

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-17T03:10:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-09
  • City: WINTERVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 9, 2023, one (1) 325-gallon tote of sodium hydroxide leaked approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior due to a faulty valve. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the impacted site. MEG personnel transferred all virgin product into one (1) new 275-gallon tote via diaphragm pump. The crew then utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all sodium hydroxide impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The damaged tote and drum of waste were transported for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023060290
item.description:
Report X-2023060290

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-17T03:10:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE MANAGER IN THE IC PICK AREA ALERTED US TO A LEAKING BUCKET/PAIL. WE REPSONDED IMMEDIATLEY AND FOUND THAT THE BUCKET HAD LEAKED ON A NON HAZMAT PACKAGE AND IT SATURATED THE BOX INSIDE AND OUT. WE MADE SURE TO CLEAN UP THE AREA AND PUT ALL OF OUR MATERIALS IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE WITH THE LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE AND THE NON HAZMAT PACKAGE. WE THEM ISOLATED THESE IN THE HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: THE BOTTOM OF THE PAIL HAD A 1/8" CRACK ON IT AND THAT IS WHAT LEAD TO THE RELEASE OF THE FLUID. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WE RESPONDED IMMEDIATELY AND MADE SURE THAT THE PAKCAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND MOVED TO THE HAZMAT CAGE.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO QA DURING THE SORT DUE TO THE SIDE OF THE BOX BEING WET. PKG WAS THEN SECURED UNTIL IT COULD BE FURHTER INSPECTED. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE JUGS. PACKAGE MAY HAVE BEEN LOADED OR HANDLED IMPROPERLY CAUSING IT TO LEAK EVEN FURTHER. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS UPRIGHT AND SECURED IN A HAZMAT DRUM.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package found on dock laying sideways, with the orientation arrows not upright. Package was wet from inner contents. Inner contents consist of 2 plastic bottles about a half gallon in size. Both spilt from the caps. DescribePack: due to laying sideways, inner liquid excaped the caps on the plastic bottles. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: package was immediately placed within a yellow salvage drum.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: This package was in unload and it was mishandled and the body of the bottle is cracked at the time found it was put in black container and brought to QA. DescribePack: The package failure is a crack in the body near the handle where it is put togather and the crack is about 3/16 long DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Was put in container and put some absorbing around it also and put in the QA haz-mat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023050808
item.description:
Report X-2023050808

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-17T03:10:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-13
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to us from the IC belt manager. He found this in the back of the building on one of his dock walks during the sort and let us know that there was powder coming out of the package. Upon inspection we saw that this was solid chlorine granules. The package has been attempted 3 times by our delivery driver and the customer was never home to sign for this package. These packages aren't meant to be handled this amount of times. We isolated this in a lined hazmat tote in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The lid was loose upon inspection and that is where the powder was coming from. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We made sure that the area where the package was found was clean and no powder contaminated any other boxes

item.title: Report X-2023050222
item.description:
Report X-2023050222

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-17T03:10:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-29
  • City: LINCOLNTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Bottles came out of box when being unloaded and hit the concrete floor. It appears that the bottom of the box came open simply from not enough/poor quality clear plastic tape. It appears that when the bottom of the box came open the bottles fell out and two of the bottles' lids cracked and about half of one bottle leaked out and about 1/3 of another bottle leaked out. All bottles were put into a plastic tote immediately. DescribePack: Tape on box appeared to be not enough/not strong enough for the weight of package. The lids were not strong enough to handle the pressure of being dropped. Liquid leaked out of the top of the containers after they fell out of the box and after the lids cracked and came off. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: All bottles were put into a plastic tote bin immediately then moved to a well ventilated area away from workers.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being inspected prior to being damaged. Upon inspection cans were dented and were checked for any signs of leakage due to wet outer packaging possibly due to rain. After showing no signs of leakage box was dried and retaped after QA inspection in unload, package was brought to the attention of the unload manager. Package was considered a damage at around 11:30am on 04/28/2023. DescribePack: After retaping package one dented aluminum can on top seal was leaking causing internal leaking out of the 6 cans. All six cans are dented but one is leaking through the top seal on the edges of the can (not the cap). Fedex label is soiled and bottom of the package is damp. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: No cleanup needed. Liquid soaked up by fiberboard outer packaging. Cans stayed in upright position to prevent any more spillage

item.title: Report X-2023040654
item.description:
Report X-2023040654

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-17T03:10:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-10
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023040654 SequenceEvent: THE JERRICAN WAS FOUND IN OUR HAZMAT CAGE IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE UNDER THE AIR VENT. THERE IS A 1/8TH INCH PUNCTURE IN THE BOTTOM OUTER EDGE OF THE JERRICAN WHICH CAUSED ALMOST ALL OF THE LIQUID TO COME OUT OF THIS PACKAGE. DescribePack: SMALL 1/8TH INCH HOLE IN THE BOTTOME OUTER EDGE OF THE JERRICAN DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SOMEONE PUT THIS IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND LOCKED IT IN THE HAZMAT CAGE. WE DISCOVERED THIS JERRICAN WHILE SEARCHING FOR ANOTHER HAZMAT THAT WE HAD ALREADY SUBMITTED TO HESS. 2. X-2023040657 SequenceEvent: THIS BOX WAS ON THE TABLE AT QA1 CAGE IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE WHEN WE DISCOVERED THIS. UPON INSPECTION, THERE ARE 2 CORNERS OF THE BOX THAT ARE WET FROM THE LEAKING OF THE TOILET BOWL CLEANER. THE 4 BOTTLES ALL HAD LOOSE CAPS AND THEY ALL HAD SMALL LEAKS WHICH TOUCHED EACH BOTTLE ON THE OUTSIDE AND CONTAMINATED THEM. WE IMMEDIATLEY RELOCATED THE LINED TOTE WITH THE LEAKING HAZMAT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND PLACED UNDER THE VENT. YOU COULD SMELL THE ODOR COMING FROM THE PACKAGE. DescribePack: 4 LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WE RELOCATED THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND PLACED UNDER THE AIR VENT TO HELP WITH THE ODOR.

item.title: Report X-2023040651
item.description:
Report X-2023040651

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-17T03:10:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-10
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WE DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE IN THE HAZMAT CAGE UNDER THE AIR VENT. IT LOOKS LIKE THIS WAS LOADED ONTO A VAN AND THEN REMOVED THE SAME DAY. THE QA TEAM WASNT INFORMED OF THIS AT THE TIME. THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE AND WE LOCATED THIS WHILE LOOKING FOR ANOTHER HAZMAT THAT CAME IN WITH A DISPOSTION. THE PACKAGE HAD ALREADY BEEN PLACED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND LOCKED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: ONE OF THE 4 BOTTLES OF ALCOHOL HAD A 1/8 INCH PUNCTURE IN THE FOIL SEAL UNDER THE CAP WHICH LED TO THE SPILL. ALL 4 BOTTLES WERE CONTAMINATED BY THE ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL. THE CAPS WERE ALL LOOSE WHEN WE DISCOVERED THIS PACKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND STAGED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE UNDER THE AIR VENT.

item.title: Report X-2023040504
item.description:
Report X-2023040504

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-17T03:10:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-04
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: We were alerted to come to the end of the IC2 belt because a hazmat package had a big wet spot on the top and side. Once we inspected the package we noticed 1 of the 3 bottles was leaking. All 3 caps were loose and the one bottle that was leaking had a paper seal that was torn which led to the wet spot on the package. It also appeared that the package could have been dropped. The leak contaminated all 3 bottles. DescribePack: Loose caps on all 3 bottles but only 1 leaked. The paper seal on the leaking bottle had a 1/8 inch hole/crack in the top of the seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We responded quickly to the radio call of a potential hazmat leaking package. We isolated it immediately in the hazmat cage in a lined tote and place under the air vent. There were no other packages that were effected by the leaking hazmat package.

  • Description: During the unloading phase of a trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured a pail in front of the pallet. item.title: Report X-2023031265
item.description:
Report X-2023031265

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-16T21:08:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-24
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package made it to a van and was loaded on to the van. We were informed by the belt manager shortly after it was loaded that the top of the package looked wet. We went over and inspected this and all 3 of the caps were loose but 1 had a contaminated paper seal with a hole in the corner of the seal. It leaked out into the box and contaminated all 3 bottles of this hazmat package. We placed this into a lined hazmat tote and moved it to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: 1 loose cap had a 1/16 inch hole in the paper seal which led to the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We were able to respond quickly to the radio call that there was a potential leaking hazmat on a van. We removed the package upon inspection and isolated this in the hazmat cage.

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-28
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NWN experienced a release of UN2735 "Dabco T" from (2) 55-gallon metal drums. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5' x 5' area of the trailer & dock floor due to faulty leaking seams. The drums were each placed into a 95-gallon poly over pack. Absorbent were deployed and worked into the impacted areas then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed that approximately ½ a pound of product released to a 2’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor. The fiber drum was punctured by a forklift blade. All released material along with the damaged drum was collected and containerized into a 55-gallon plastic drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Shield Engineering was contacted to manage the cleanup. Approximately 10 gallons of product was released. It did not impact soil or surface water, and absorbent had already been applied. It was due to faulty equipment on the customer's side. Our customer had tanks checked & repaired before next delivery.

  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured two drums in front of the pallet. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered in the unload area. Once it was determined it was damaged it was immediately placed away from personnel and other packages. The package was then placed to start the Hazmat process. DescribePack: The paint was leaking from the plug. It appeared to have paint clips securing the top however it is unsure if the contents spilled due to a loose top. The paint had covered the entire plastic drum thus not allowing the cause to be determined. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed immediately into a leak proof bin away from other packages and personnel. The process for the Hazmat was started within an hour of determining the contents.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Midway through unloading trailer #956568 from 282-CHAR-A, a damaged hazmat was discovered by a PH. Mgr was immediately notified and QA contacted. Neutralizer was placed on liquid in trailer and some of the affected pkgs. Damaged Hazmat placed in bag and drum. Mgr removed remaining pkgs along with QA. A forever smalls bag was wet with liquid. Clean-up performed. Pkgs placed in quarantine area. Total of 26 pkgs inspected 7 repacked, 5 damaged, 14 no spillage. DescribePack: Hazmat pkg was found with directional arrows not pointing up but to the side. Sulfuric acid leaked from caps and caused hole on the entire side of the pkg. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Neutralizer placed on liquid and clean up performed. Quarantine of packages.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was alerted to hazmat at 1am. Package was brought to QA by area manager. During inspection it was found. One plastic jerrycan had black electrical tape around the cap of the jug. The tape around the jug did not stop the package from leaking, as it appears it was leaking from the front side of the jug. The jug was placed into a 20-gallon salvage drum and packed tight with cardboard to prevent movement and leakage. DescribePack: The failure was caused by black electrical tape around the jugs cap and seal. This was poorly packaged and shipped. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The jug was placed into a 20-gallon salvage drum and packed tight with cardboard to prevent movement and leakage.

Leak was contained within bag and package was processed as a fully-regulated damaged hazmat. DescribePack: loose crew-on cap, now tightened back. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in bag and plastic tub and removed from system flow to QA

item.title: Report X-2022120803
item.description:
Report X-2022120803

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-16T21:08:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-08
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was a drum with a tension ring seal. the ring was locked closed with a zip tie. The package was unload off the trailer with no issue. Then as the package was being lifted and placed on a tugger cart, it was dropped on it's side. The package then leaked liquid. I would guess that the inner bag of the package must have already leaked out into the general cylinder prior to it being dropped by the package handler. DescribePack: The seal obviously was not working properly, because it should have prevented liquid from leaking out. also there was insufficient package material. The drum itself was only about 35% full, and then the just put one little thing of bubble wrap in it. They did not fill all the air space within the container to make it more damage resistant. There was also two separate sets of OP-900 Hazmat Documents on the package, making it difficult to determine what the actual content were. The two sets of documents had different track ids and different UN numbers. Both track ids were picked up from the same shipper on the same day. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the spill was brought to my attention, the drum had already been turned back upright and was no longer leaking. I put on ppe and moved the leaking package and other affected packages away from the site. Then I covered all the leaked liquid with chemical neutralizer. Then I called the hazmat hotline. They sent a vendor out here to finish clean up. The vendor cleaned up the neutralizer from the spill area, as well as treated the packages that the chemical spilled on. They removed the leaking drum from our building in a larger drum. The other affected packages that were treated by the vendor were to large to be returned to the shipper, so those were scrapped.

item.title: Report E-2022120525
item.description:
Report E-2022120525

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-16T21:08:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-07
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1743 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NCH. It was reported that approximately 16 ounces of UN3266 AFCO 8626 RS released from a 55-gallon plastic drum due to a pinhole puncture. The release impacted the concrete dock floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 3' x 3' area of the dock floor due to a pinhole puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly drum. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage. 2 E-2022120554.During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 55 gallon drum of AFCO 8626 RS (un3266) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

  • Description: XPO Terminal NCH called in to report a spill of UN2924 Flexipel 61LF from a 55-gallon metal drum caused by a puncture of unknown origin and impacting the drum itself along with a piece of cardboard it was loaded on. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to the concrete dock in a 4' x 4' area due to a forklift puncture. The damaged container was containerized into an 85-gallon poly drum. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and collected along with absorbent pads and impacted cardboard into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2022110657

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-16T21:08:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-23
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1158 EST, XPO Logistics terminal NWN contacted ERTS regarding a cargo release. It was reported that a 55 gallon metal drum of UN1263, 260 Duro Stain was located damaged releasing an estimated 10 gallons of product to the trailer floor and gravel below. ERTS dispatched contractors for containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5' x 2' area of the trailer floor and a 1' x 1' area of the gravel lot below due to a pinhole puncture. The damaged drum was collected into an 85-gallon poly drum. Absorbents were the worked into the impacted areas. Contractors collected the impacted gravel and absorbents into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-14
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS UNLOADED 11/14 AND IT WAS DISCOVERED IT HAD LEAKED INSIDE THE BOX. BOX WAS GIVEN TO QA. IT WAS THEN SECURED AND INSPECTED. After further research, the pkg was first discovered as leaking on Saturday 11/12. I was not notified of the issue and a improper code was applied to the pkg. Employee stated the side appeared wet on 11/12. Pkg sat at the damage area till Monday 11/14. DescribePack: 2 OF THE 4 CAPS WERE LOOSE AND LIQUID LEAKED INTO THE BOX. BOX WAS DAMAGED AND UNABLE TO BE RE-PACKED. NO HOLES OR CRACKS ON ANY OF THE JUGS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGES WERE PLACED IN A HAZMAT TOTE TILL THEY COULD BE INSPECTED FURTHER.

  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS SITTING AT THE DAMAGE TABLE BY QA ON 11/14/22 AROUND 6AM. THERE WAS NO IB SCAN SO UNSURE WHEN THE PACKAGE WAS ACTUALLY PLACED THERE. PKG WAS THEN SECURED AND INSPECTED AFTER THE SORT. DescribePack: 1 OF THE 4 CAPS ON THE JUGS WAS LOOSE AND THE LIQUID CONTENTS LEAKED AND DAMAGED THE BOX. LEAK WAS MINIMAL BUT UNABLE TO REPACK AND SEND ON. PKG WAS ALSO LIKELY MISHANDLED OR LOADED IMPROPERLY AND THAT CONTRIBUTED TO THE DAMAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SECURED WITH QA. SAT WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS UPRIGHT.

item.title: Report X-2022110871
item.description:
Report X-2022110871

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-16T21:08:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-11
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was alerted to a Hazmat spill in trailer 959266 in unload B, Door 203. QA team went with PPE and 3 salvage drums. 3 salvage drums. Package was sitting at the front of the trailer doors. Package was badly damaged. Due to one of the plastic jugs having a crack on the bottom of the jug. Package was also next to a Samsclub package that had also been damaged. Both liquids had mixed inside the trailer. Packages were gathered and brought to the hazmat cage for further inspection. It was found. One jug of Pro Brown Heavy Duty coil cleaner had spilled all of its contents. And one bottle of Pinesol had half of its contents spilled. The coil cleaner and Pinesol mix had also spilled onto a Flammable hazmat causing the outer packaging to be damaged. Business objects showed the corrosive hazmat had been sent overhead from 310-BRSL-T at 5:07pm on 11-10-2022 DescribePack: Package was improperly handled as it was sent overhead and was dropped 6 feet from the tray to the trailer belt. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a 30-gallon salvage drum to prevent remaining liquid from spilling.

DescribePack: 1/8TH INCH HOLE IN SIDE OF ONE OF THE BOTTLES. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WE INSPECTED THE PACKAGE AND MADE SURE THAT IT DIDNT LEAK ON ANY OTHER PACKAGES ON THE IC BELT. WE THEN PUT THIS PACKAGE IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND STORED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE.

  • Description: On November 4, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing sodium hydroxide (UN1824) was damaged and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental (ME) to complete the necessary corrective actions. ME personnel overpacked the damaged drum and deployed neutralizing agent. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all sodium hydroxide-impacted material in the same one (1) 95-gallon overpack.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 18, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of corrosive liquid (UN3267) was punctured and released approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of product to the trailer, tires, and pavement underneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to perform the necessary corrective actions. FCE personnel utilized absorbents, soda ash, and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface. The crew then containerized the damaged drum and all UN3267-impacted material into four (4) drums for disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was discovered during pre-sort inspection of Hazmat cage; Pkg was in lined Hazmat tote on vent table; Pkg was inspected; placed in new lined Hazmat tote & returned to Hazmat cage. DescribePack: Upon inspection pkg had been previously repacked but was not coded or relabeled; All labels had been re-taped onto a corrugated carton; Corners of packaging were wet & there was discoloration from spillage inside as well as liquid leakage in bottom of plastic bags ; 4/4 Jugs were damaged due to vents on inner cap seals leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened, spill dry material was used, pkg was placed in lined Hazmat tote & returned to Hazmat cage.

  • Description: When the driver went to pick up the loaded trailer that was staged at the Quala tankwash, he observed some product on the outside of the trailer. Nothing appeared to have impacted the ground around the trailer. This trailer has a rubber lining on it. He tightened the lugs down more than usual which stopped the leak in transit. However this is usually an indicator that the lining around the collar where the dome lid comes down is having an issue where the rubber doesn't make perfect surface contact that will need to be repaired. Trailer is out of service pending repairs.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: According to Business Objects package arrived at facility on 9-12-2022 at 9:16 a.m. receiving an overhead scan once. Package came back overhead for a second scan at 9:20 a.m. Package was then brought to the IC A belt receiving a NC scan and label at 12:00p.m. to then be scanned to door number 145 trailer number 553524. Where package remained for two more sorts. Package was brought to QA OPT sort to be processed in Hazmat cage. No manager or package handler reported the hazmat leaking. Proper PPE was used to clean and place both bottles into salvage drum with original package. DescribePack: Package failure was both plastic jugs caps were loose at the top of both bottles. DurationRel: 9 and MitigateEffect: Package was brought into Hazmat cage upon discovery at 5a.m. package was then inspected and placed into a 20 gallon salvage drum caps were tightened in order to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report E-2022090770
item.description:
Report E-2022090770

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-16T21:08:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-06
  • City: MORRISVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1011 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NRD. It was reported that approximately 10 gallons of UN1790, 8, 6.1, II released from a 10 gallon plastic pail due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the concrete dock floor. ERTS dispatched First Call Environmental to conduct cleanup. At 1251 ET, FCE personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10 gallons of product released to a 15' x 15' area of the dock floor from two damaged containers. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and collected. The impacted pallet was then cut up for disposal. All waste was placed into (2) 30 gallon poly and (1) 55 gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022090609
item.description:
Report E-2022090609

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-16T21:08:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-13
  • City: HAMLET
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 09/13/2022 at approximately 2051 hours personnel in the Hamlet yard reported a nineteen car derailment. In the derailment ETCX421006 a loaded tank car of Acetic Anhydride was found to be leaking from the base of the liquid line where it meets the pressure plate during the initial inspection by H/M James. The tank car was dripping about every 20 seconds. The car was isolated and the Shipper, Eastman Chemical Company was notified. Marion Environmental Inc (MEI) responded. The leak was contained until the tank car was set up during re-railing operations. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the Shipper Thomas McGourty 423-229-1491, TommMcGourt@Eastman.com. The tank car was isolated and will be transloaded by MEI.

DescribePack: Pkg had discoloration from leakage on top of box & on top corner of one side; 1/4 Cans had loose caps; 4/4 were soiled/stained from internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened, pkg was placed in lined Hazmat tote & relocated to Hazmat cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was brought to QA from the bulk area at the back of the building by an area manager. It appeared to have been dropped during the unload and was leaking from the caps. They had placed it in a lined tote. We secured it in the hazmat cage under the vent. We made sure that both bottles were set upright and no longer leaking. DescribePack: The caps stated leaking after the box was dropped during unload. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We made sure the hazmat was in a lined tote in under the vent and that the bottles were sitting upright and that they were no longer leaking.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered as it was unloaded off a semi trailer onto the unload rollers. The package was wet. The sort manager noticed the leaking package, placed it in a plastic tote and called for QA to come get it. I took the package, opened it and discovered a small amount of leakage from a loose cap. DescribePack: The outer package was still intact, well sealed. The only problem with the package was that each bottle had a piece of plastic tape around the lid to protect the seal, the tape had came off of each bottle and one bottle had a loose lid and about half (.5 gallon ) of the contents leaked out of that bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package put in a tote and moved close to a door to allow fresh air flow.

item.title: Report E-2022090564
item.description:
Report E-2022090564

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-16T21:08:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-31
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0655 ET, XPO terminal NCH requested assistance with a spill that occurred inside a trailer in Charlotte, NC. The spill consisted of a 55 gallon plastic drum of UN3149 Divosan Plus, which arrived at the terminal in a damaged state likely due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched Hepaco to conduct cleanup operations. At 0835 ET, Hepaco arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15 gallons of product released to a 6' x 40' area of the trailer floor, concrete, and asphalt lot below. The damaged drum was containerized into a 95 gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas and collected into (2) 55 gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was discovered at QA cage upon arrival to sort; Pkg was inspected & determined to have been repacked; Caps were tightened, pkg was placed in lined Hazmat tote & relocated to Hazmat cage. DescribePack: Pkg had been packed using a corrugated cardboard box & several trash bags. Contents were leaking from bottom of pkg; 2/4 Jugs were damaged due to denting and loose caps, causing internal leakage; the remaining jugs were damaged due to leakage from other contents. It was determined that the rough remaining contents of each jug were 3.78, 3.78, 0.90, and 3.00 Liters. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened on all jugs pkg was placed in lined Hazmat tote & relocated to Hazmat cage.

  • Description: On August 9, 2022, four (4) bags of Sodium Carbonate Peroxyhydrate was punctured by a forklift and released approximately a half (0.5) pound of product to the concrete dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Marion Environmental (ME) to perform the necessary corrective actions. ME personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all spent material into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-16T21:08:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-10
  • City: Charlotte
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During taxi out for take-off, a Flight Attendant smelled an electrical odor, and immediately the passenger in 16D blurted out that a man's battery is burning behind him. The Flight Attendant immediately looked at the passenger in 17E and he gives the Flight Attendant his iced tea bottle(with liquid still inside) and the battery in it. The bottle felt warm and the passenger said that his battery was the old model and that s why it probably sparked. He said everything was fine and he put it in his ice tea drink with the lid closed. The number 2 Flight Attendant, came up to the number 4 Flight Attendant and told her that she had to let the Captain know in case he wanted to throw out the battery or have the man investigated. We called the Captain, and he said that we are going back to the gate to get rid of this battery. We had a Gate Agent come on board and talk to the man and found that he had more batteries in his bag. We asked if he could just leave the batteries so he could still fly with us, and he refused to do so. The customer and his lithium ion batteries were removed and the flight re-departed. Spoke with the customer on the phone. He had 4 lithium ion battery cells, 2 in his e-cigarette and 2 spares. One of the spares must have arced with the zipper in his carry-on bag causing a short. He had a carryin case but it had broken so he did not have it to protect the batteries from short circuit.

item.title: Report E-2023010128
item.description:
Report E-2023010128

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-16T21:08:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-30
  • City: MEBANE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 30, 2022, ERTS was contacted by Landstar personnel in Mebane, North Carolina requesting facilitation of the cleanup of a trailer that was reported to be transporting empty drums. While unloading the drums, the vehicle operator noticed residual liquid on the trailer floor that was presumed to be from drums that were left at the customer’s location before relocating to a nearby Love’s Travel Stop. Upon contractor arrival at the involved trailer, the trailer was empty and residual liquid was observed on the trailer floor. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed the release of approximately 5 gallons of Sipomer Iboma HP (Environmentally Hazardous Substance, Liquid, n.o.s. (Isobornyl Methacrylate), UN3082) to a 2’ by 10’ area of the trailer floor. The contractors then utilized clay absorbent material to address residual product observed. The damaged 55-gallon drums were placed into (2) 85-gallon metal drum overpacks. The spent absorbents and all other waste generated were containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste drums were then transported by the contractor to Clean Management Environmental Group in Walterboro, South Carolina for proper disposal.

ERTS dispatched HEPACO to perform all onsite clean up operations. At 1400 ET, HEPACO arrived on site and confirmed approximately (5)-gallons of product released affecting a 15’ x 10’ area of the dock floor. Contractors collected and containerized the damaged drum and all clean-up debris into (1) 85-gallons overpacked metal drum. Contractors departed the site with all waste.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazardous package was being loaded into trailer and dropped during the process of being loaded into the trailer. Package was then brought over from the load-side to QA. DescribePack: Both containers inside of package had loose lids and the corrosive liquid that they contained corroded the box. Corrosion took place inside and outside of package. One side of the box failed to remain attached and was loosely hanging from package and was wet. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazardous package was put into safe containment and moved to the hazmat area for additional processing to avoid any damage or contact.

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal NAV reported approximately 7.5 gallons of Ethyl Alcohol 140 Proof were released from (2) 5-gallon plastic jugs due to the jugs being damaged during transit. The release impacted the inside of trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel was capable of cleaning the release. Terminal personnel placed (2) 5-gallon plastic jugs and oil dri into a 55-gallon metal drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
